intro: Teclea natalensis, commonly known as Natal teclea, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Teclea natalensis is often found in woodland and thicket habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in local flora.
